de.mrapp.android.dialog

Class AbstractHeaderDialogFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • DialogFragment
      • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractMaterialDialogFragment
        • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractHeaderDialogFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.DialogInterface, Dialog, HeaderDialog, HeaderDialogDecorator, MaterialDialog, MaterialDialogDecorator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    WizardDialog

    public abstract class AbstractHeaderDialogFragment
extends AbstractMaterialDialogFragment
implements HeaderDialog
    An abstract base class for all dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices, are able to show fragments and may contain a header.
    Since:
    3.2.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface android.content.DialogInterface

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractHeaderDialogFragment

        protected AbstractHeaderDialogFragment(android.content.Context context,
                                       int themeResourceId)
        Creates a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices, is able to show fragments and may contain a header.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the dialog, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        themeResourceId - The resource id of the theme, which should be used by the dialog, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid theme

      • onAttachDecorators

        protected void onAttachDecorators(android.view.View view,
                                  FragmentManager fragmentManager)
        Description copied from class: AbstractMaterialDialogFragment
        The method, which is invoked when the dialog's decorators should be attached. This method may be overridden by subclasses in order to attach additional decorators.
        Overrides:
        onAttachDecorators in class AbstractMaterialDialogFragment
        Parameters:
        view - The root view of the view hierarchy, which should be modified by the decorators, as an instance of the class View. The view may not be null
        fragmentManager - The fragment manager, which can be used to show fragment within the dialog, as an instance of the class FragmentManager. The fragment manager may not be null

      • onDetachDecorators

        protected void onDetachDecorators()
        Description copied from class: AbstractMaterialDialogFragment
        The method, which is invoked when the dialog's decorators should be detached. This method must be overridden by subclasses if they attach additional decorators.
        Overrides:
        onDetachDecorators in class AbstractMaterialDialogFragment
